bug.author: neurovish
bug.summary: Epochs run long when internet is not available
bug.description:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/evilsocket/pwnagotchi/files/3836535/pwnagotchi-test.log>pwnagotchi-test.log</denchmark-link>
When there is no connectivity to the internet (specifically the API, <denchmark-link:https://api.pwnagotchi.ai>https://api.pwnagotchi.ai</denchmark-link> ), pwnagotchi runs very slowly (long epochs) with CPU usage under 50%. Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Power on pwnagotchi with no internet Wait for AI to load Wait an hour or so After about an hour of runtime, the logs should show long-running epochs ( > 20min) once the AI has loaded.
Expectation is the realtime length for an epoch to be far less than 20 minutes. With internet connectivity, epochs usually last less than 5 minutes. Environment
pwnagotchi v1.2.1 pwngrid v1.10.1 pi0w
Attached file shows output of "egrep -a "[epoch|brain.nn" /var/log/pwnagotchi.log |tail -n 80". The first 33 epochs in this file cover almost 8 hours of runtime off of a battery with no internet connectivity. The next 6 epochs cover 43 minutes of runtime off of a USB connection with connection sharing blocked by the host. Also of note is the pwngrid-peer.log, which mostly consists of lines that look like: 2019-11-01 15:58:59 err POST <denchmark-link:https://api.pwnagotchi.ai/api/v1/unit/enroll>https://api.pwnagotchi.ai/api/v1/unit/enroll</denchmark-link> (20.012588s) Post <denchmark-link:https://api.pwnagotchi.ai/api/v1/unit/enroll>https://api.pwnagotchi.ai/api/v1/unit/enroll</denchmark-link> : dial tcp: lookup api.pwnagotchi.ai on 9.9.9.9:53: read udp 10.0.0.2:53978->9.9.9.9:53: i/o timeout
